parameters.name: PoolIds
parameters.description: The IDs of the IPv6 address pools. (string) ---

parameters.name: Filters
parameters.description: One or more filters. tag:<key> - The key/value combination of a tag assigned to the resource. Use the tag key in the filter name and the tag value as the filter value. For example, to find all resources that have a tag with the key Owner and the value TeamA, specify tag:Owner for the filter name and TeamA for the filter value. tag-key - The key of a tag assigned to the resource. Use this filter to find all resources assigned a tag with a specific key, regardless of the tag value. (dict) --- A filter name and value pair that is used to return a more specific list of results from a describe operation. Filters can be used to match a set of resources by specific criteria, such as tags, attributes, or IDs. If you specify multiple filters, the filters are joined with an AND, and the request returns only results that match all of the specified filters. For more information, see List and filter using the CLI and API in the Amazon EC2 User Guide. Name (string) --- The name of the filter. Filter names are case-sensitive. Values (list) --- The filter values. Filter values are case-sensitive. If you specify multiple values for a filter, the values are joined with an OR, and the request returns all results that match any of the specified values. (string) ---

nested_items.name: Ipv6Pools
nested_items.description: Information about the IPv6 address pools.

nested_items.name: PoolId
nested_items.description: The ID of the address pool.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: The description for the address pool.

nested_items.name: PoolCidrBlocks
nested_items.description: The CIDR blocks for the address pool.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: Any tags for the address pool.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: The token to use to retrieve the next page of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.
